project_description: A simple Flutter application that displays text of a Cat with a clock icon. When the text is clicked, it changes to Dog with a person icon.
architecture_overview: The application follows a modular structure with Cubit for state management. It has clearly separated layers for UI, state management, and data models.

files.name: lib/main.dart
files.description: Entry point of the application. It sets up the Cubit provider and initializes the home screen.

methods.name: build
methods.description: Builds the main widget tree for the application.

files.name: lib/cubits/text_cubit.dart
files.description: Cubit class managing the state of the text being displayed.

files.name: lib/models/text_state.dart
files.description: Data model representing the state of the text being displayed.

files.name: lib/widgets/text_widget.dart
files.description: Widget displaying the text along with an icon. It reacts to user taps.

methods.name: build
methods.description: Builds the widget tree for displaying text and icon.

widgets.name: TextWidget
widgets.description: A widget that displays text along with an icon. It changes the text on tap.

cubits.name: TextCubit
cubits.description: Manages the state of the text being displayed. It toggles between 'Cat' and 'Dog'.

models.name: TextState
models.description: Represents the state of the text being displayed, including the text content and associated icon.

dependencies.name: flutter
dependencies.purpose: Flutter framework for building the UI.

dependencies.name: flutter_bloc
dependencies.purpose: Bloc and Cubit state management library.

sequence_diagram:
@startuml
actor User
User -> TextWidget: tap
TextWidget -> TextCubit: toggleText()
TextCubit -> TextState: update
TextState -> TextWidget: new state
@enduml
state_management_flow: The state is managed using the Cubit pattern. The TextCubit toggles the text between 'Cat' and 'Dog'. The state is represented by the TextState model, which includes the text and associated icon. The TextWidget listens to state changes via BlocBuilder and updates the displayed text and icon accordingly.
navigation_flow: The application has a single screen. Navigation is not required for this simple application.

pubspec_yaml.name: flutter_cubit_example
pubspec_yaml.description: A simple Flutter application demonstrating the Cubit pattern.
